name: LyondellBasell Industries N.V.
bossPosition: Sr Vice President, Olefins & Polyolefins Europe, Asia & International
goal:
LyondellBasell is one of the largest plastics, chemicals and refining companies in the world. LyondellBasell sells products into more than 100 countries and is the world's largest producer of polymer compounds and the largest licensor of polyolefin technologies. In 2019, LyondellBasell was named for the second successive year to Fortune magazine's list of the "World's Most Admired Companies."

LyondellBasell produces materials and products that are used in items that improve the quality of life for people around the world including packaging, electronics, automotive parts, home furnishings, construction materials and biofuels, and are key to advancing solutions to modern challenges like enhancing food safety through lightweight and flexible packaging, protecting the purity of water supplies through stronger and more versatile pipes, improving the safety, comfort and fuel efficiency of cars and trucks on the road, and ensuring the safe and effective functionality in electronics and appliances.

LyondellBasell Industries N.V. is a global, independent chemical company, was incorporated under Dutch law. on October 15, 2009. LyondellBasell is listed on the New York Stock Exchange.


Key company facts (2017):

• 13.400 employees worldwide
• 55 manufacturing sites in 18 countries
• Annual revenues of $34,5 billions
• Listed in the S&P 500 Index

In Europe, LyondellBasell operates 17 sites in 6 countries, employing around 6.000 people. Our locations include:

• France: plants in Berre and Fos-sur-Mer
• Germany: technology centre in Frankfurt, plants in Bayreuth, Frankfurt, Ludwigshafen, Münchsmünster and Wesseling
• Italy: technology centre in Ferrara, plants in Brindisi and Ferrara
• Netherlands: administrative office/headquarters in Rotterdam, plants in Botlek, Maasvlakte and Moerdijk
• Spain: plant in Tarragona
• United Kingdom: administrative office/headquarters in London, plants in Carrington and Milton Keynes
